titleStmt.title: William A. Nichols, Special Orders, No. 203
CWG12520

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Union Artillery, Navy and Marines Primary Source Documents ; Misc U.S.C.T. Primary Source Documents
msIdentifier.idno: Box 14, Folder MISCELLANEOUS - BTRY E - 1st REGT LIGHT ARTILLERY 4th BTRY

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, May 3d, 1865.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 203.

The unexpired portion of the sentence of the General Court Martial, convened by Special Orders, No. 152, Headquarters, District of Kentucky, of June 27th, 1864, in the case of Private Charles McGuire, Battery "E," 1st Kentucky Artillery, now supposed to be in confinement at Fort Jefferson, Florida, is remitted, and he will be discharged the service of the United States, upon the receipt of this Order at the place where he may be serving.

By order of the President of the United States:
W. A. NICHOLS,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
Saml Breck
Assistant Adjutant General.

Camp E.
1' Arty
War Department
Adj't. Genl office
Washington May. 3. 1865
Nichols W. A.
A. A. G.
Order --
Remitting unexpired portion of sentence of Genl Court Martial in case of private Chas. McGuire Batt. E. 1" Ky arty, and discharging him from the service --
Recd A. G. O. Ky 9 May 1865
